quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Patent and Pyramids
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, egypt, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which peculiarity of the Great Pyramid interior distinguishes it from the other pyramids?

options.text: The ascending passages and upper chambers
The larger number of its chambers

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The ascending passages and upper chambers

questions.question: Which musician holds a patent for an electronic device that helps a composer, a musician, or a conductor to interactively select parts of a musical score?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harry Connick, Jr.

questions.question: Where in Egypt are the Pyramids of Giza situated?

options.text: In the very heart of Egypt

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: On the outskirts of Cairo

questions.question: Which one of the Pyramids of Giza has visibly retained its polished limestone casing at its apex?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Pyramid of Khafre

questions.question: The Great Pyramid is one of the pyramids of the Giza pyramid complex. Which monument is NOT a part of that complex?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Pyramid of Amenemhet I

questions.question: Which one of these people holds several patents for fishing lures?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gary Burghoff

questions.question: If you recall well the performances of these men, it won’t be hard to guess which one of them holds a patent for a device that allows a performer to lean forward past his center of gravity.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michael Jackson

questions.question: The Great Pyramid of Giza is believed to have been built as the tomb of this Egyptian pharaoh.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Khufu

questions.question: In 1974, this lady got a patent for a pantyhose with a shaping band for cheeky derriere relief.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Julie Newmar

questions.question: What was the original height of the Great Pyramid?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 481 feet

questions.question: Which of these people was issued patent # 6469 for a new method of buoying vessels over shoals?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Abraham Lincoln

questions.question: What is the estimated frame of time in which the Great Pyramid was constructed?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 15 - 20 years

questions.question: Which of one these people holds patent #1370316 for a divers suit?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harry Houdini

questions.question: This man holds a patent for a special Jacuzzi-type of spa bath for women that includes a chair, a circulation valve, and a device for eliminating the dirty water.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Penn Jillette

questions.question: Under his real name this person holds patent #140245 for an improved method for scrapbooking.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mark Twain

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Crusaders and Sam Houston
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, field, hattin. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What Dukes of Hazzard star played Thumblerig the Gambler in the 1960 movie The Alamo?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Denver Pyle

questions.question: The Alamo mission was captured on this day in 1836.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: March 6

questions.question: Towards the end of the 14th century, vandalized by an angered Sufi Muslim, the Great Sphinx of Giza lost what essential piece.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Its nose

questions.question: Richard Widmark played Jim Bowie in the 1960 movie The Alamo.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The Crusaders lost the Battle of Hattin because of the stupidity of King Guy of Jerusalem who insisted on marching the Crusaders in heavy armor through arid, waterless land and demanding the enemy come out and fight like good Christian soldiers. What Muslin leader was able to lead his quick, mobile cavalry to victory over the Knights Templar and the army of the Crusaders?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Saladin

questions.question: Sam Houston avenged the deaths of those killed at the Alamo in this battle.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Battle of San Jacinto

questions.question: What word refers to the hundreds of flat-roofed Egyptian tombs built round the Pyramids of Giza?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mastabas

questions.question: How did General Santa Anna escape during the battle with Sam Houston (only to be caught the next day)?

options.text: He pretended to be dead in the grass.
He jumped in his Buick and headed to the river.
He switched uniforms with someone else.
He was dressed as a peasant.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was dressed as a peasant.

questions.question: When was this headline breaking news:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: June 13, 1994

questions.question: Dennis Quaid played Sam Houston in the 2004 movie The Alamo.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: King Carl XVI Gustaf ascended to the throne on September 15, 1973, after the death of his grandfather, King Gustaf VI Adolf. Carl XVI Gustaf, who is probably best known as the presenter of the Nobel Prizes,
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dyslexia

questions.question: Who portrayed Davy Crockett in the 1960 movie The Alamo?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Wayne

questions.question: What common feature do all of the entrances of the Pyramids in Giza share?

options.text: They all face the exact north.
They all face the exact west.
They all face the Nile River bank.
They are all oriented towards the Sphinx.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They all face the exact north.

questions.question: Gustav has been a common name for Swedish monarchs since the reign of Gustav Vasa or Gustav I.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Denmark

questions.question: Never in the field of human conflict was so much owed by so many to so few. These words uttered by Winston Churchill refer to the bravery of the men serving in the British Royal Air Force. What is the name given to the air warfare that was carried out by the powerful Luftwaffe against the RAF
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Battle of Britain

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Century and Battle
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, discovery, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Tet Offensive was the first major defeat for the US/ARVN military forces in the Vietnam War.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In this century, the Muslim conquests began, and the population on the planet was reduced to approximately 208 million people.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 7th century AD

questions.question: The Great Fire of London and the Great Plague of London occurred in this century.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 17th century AD

questions.question: Operation Barbarossa is the largest land invasion in history. The superior German army moved further and faster than any other army in the history of modern warfare. But it was in the house-to-house and factory-to-factory fighting that the mighty German Sixth Army was defeated. What battle was the turning point for the Eastern Front in World War II?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Battle of Stalingrad

questions.question: It was on September 18,1862 that General Robert E. Lee and the Confederate Army of Northern Virgina battled General George McClellan on a cornfield near Sharpsburg, Maryland. What is the name of the battle that is often called the bloodiest single day of warfare in American history?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Antietam

questions.question: In this century gunpowder was first used in a battle, and lions become extinct in Europe.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 10th century AD

questions.question: During what century did Ramesses III, Pharaoh of Egypt, live, rule and die?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 12th century BC

questions.question: In a few minutes of time, skill and luck met over the waters of the Pacific in June 1942. American SBD Dauntless dive bombers from the USS Yorktown and Enterprise struck three Japanese carriers and put them out of action. In what decisive battle did the Japanese lose the carriers Kaga, Soryu, Akagi and the Hiryu?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Battle of Midway

questions.question: In this century paper was first produced by Chinese people, and the Silk Road between Europe and Asia was created.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2nd century BC

questions.question: During this century the French Revolution began, and the United States Declaration of Independence was signedd.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 18th century AD

questions.question: What brilliant Carthaginian general defeated the Romans in the Second Punic War at the Battle of Cannae in 216 B.C.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hannibal

questions.question: This century saw the discovery of the Americas and of a sea route along Cape of Good Hope to India.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 15th century AD

questions.question: Duke Kazimir of Stettin, a member of the Teutonic Knights, insulted King Wladislaw II of Poland when he demanded the King come out and fight like a man. King Wladislaw answered when, by 7:00 p.m. July 15, 1410, 18,000 of the Order of Teutonic Knights were dead or dying and 14,000 of the Order were taken prisoner. Can you name this battle?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Battle of Tannenberg

questions.question: Roman Emperors Caligula, Augustus, Claudius and Nero lived in this century.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1st century AD

questions.question: During this century Constantine I ruled, and Kama Sutra was created.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 4th century AD

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Period and New York City
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, actor, bette. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What century witnessed the reign of the so-called Five Good Emperors of Rome?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2nd century AD

questions.question: What notable event happened in New York City on November 7, 1989?

options.text: The city was visited by the Pope.
A grizzly bear on the loose fell asleep on Times Square.
The first African American mayor of the city was elected.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The first African American mayor of the city was elected.

questions.question: What name is commonly used to refer to the political events that took place in 1989 and are also known as Revolutions of 1989?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Autumn of Nations

questions.question: Who named the Cambrian period?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Adam Sedgwick

questions.question: What popular artist passed away on January 23, 1989?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Salvador Dali

questions.question: What British actor was born on 23 July, 1989 in London, United Kingdom?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Daniel Radcliffe

questions.question: American actress Bette Davis, who passed away on October 6, 1989, was the the first woman to be presented with this award by the American Film Institute.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lifetime Achievement Award

questions.question: What term refers to the raise of biodiversity that occurred during the Cambrian period?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cambrian Explosion

questions.question: What movie won the Academy Award for Best Picture at the 61st Academy Awards ceremony held on March 27, 1989?

options.text: My Left Foot: The Story of Christy Brown

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rain Man

questions.question: Who was awarded the 1989 Nobel Prize for Peace?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The 14th Dalai Lama, Tenzin Gyatso

questions.question: The Cambrian period lasted from 490 million years ago to 443 million years ago.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What American rapper was born on October 4, 1989 in New York City?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lil Mama

questions.question: What American Idol winner was born on December 22, 1989 in Phoenix, Arizona?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jordin Sparks

questions.question: This animal, which lived during the early Cambrian period, is possibly one of the first fish to evolve.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Haikouichthys

questions.question: The first full-length episode of this popular TV sitcom premiered on Fox on December 17, 1989.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Simpsons

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Land and Places
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, swedenborg, places. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This is the largest island on Earth and one third of it is a national park.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Greenland

questions.question: Anomalocaris was a predatory arthropod of the Cambrian period which could reach a length of 100 cm or more.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Immanuel Kant criticized Emanuel Swedenborg and termed him a “spook hunter”.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What caused the Cambrian-Ordovician mass extinction?

options.text: A drop in oxygen levels during the late Cambrian

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Glaciation

questions.question: This is a gemstone made by fossilized tree sap that is at least 30 million years old.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Amber

questions.question: In the US, why do we change our clocks on the daylight saving time dates in April and October?

options.text: To increase the hours of the day
Because the tourist period in most countries starts in May

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To conserve energy

questions.question: During the Cambrian little or nothing lived on land.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Clouds are made up of these.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Water droplets and ice crystals

questions.question: This formation is a conical hill or mountain. It is formed by mantle material being pressed through an opening in the Earths crust.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A volcano

questions.question: Why do travelers to La Paz, Bolivia, often become ill as soon as they arrive?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Because of the altitude

questions.question: It is the only continent that does not have land areas below sea level.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Antarctica

questions.question: Japan suffers from this event very often. It is the sudden, light or violent movement of the earths surface caused by the release of energy in the earths crust.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Earthquake

questions.question: It is the longest river in the world
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Nile

questions.question: These are places of arid land with really low rainfall and high tempertures variation. Their vegetation is insignificant and the population of people and animals is very limited.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Deserts

questions.question: What ocean separated Laurentia from Baltica and Siberia during the Cambrian.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Iapetus ocean

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Baby and Pregnancy
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, people, brain. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: How far along are you approximately, when you feel the baby move for the first time?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 20 weeks

questions.question: These organs are very sensitive and often fail in people with very high blood pressure or diabetes.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: kidneys

questions.question: This gland is shaped like a butterfly and helps regulate energy in the body.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: thyroid

questions.question: What is the most common method of child birth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vaginal

questions.question: Tooth enamel is the hardest substance in the body.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of these organs has no known function in the human body?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: appendix

questions.question: What is suggested that you not do several hours before you go into labor?  It could get you embarrassed.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eat food

questions.question: The main function of this organ of respiration is to transport oxygen from the atmosphere into the bloodstream.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: lung

questions.question: This doctor takes care of you and your baby during pregnancy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Obstetrician

questions.question: The mother determines the sex of the baby.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What is also delivered along with the baby or immediately after its birth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Placenta

questions.question: The cerebellum section of the brain controls the fine movement and equilibrium, among other things.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: This is one of the first signs of pregnancy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Missed period

questions.question: These small bodies are considered left overs from the formation of the Solar system some 4.6 billion years ago.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Asteroids

questions.question: What are common side effects of pregnancy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of the these
